snippet: The rise in California’s projected budget deficit, from $9.2 billion in January, is forcing state officials to propose a new series of midyear cuts in already battered programs.
abstract: Rise in California’s projected budget deficit, to $16 billion from $9.2 billion in January, is forcing state officials to propose a new series of midyear cuts in already battered programs.
lead_paragraph: The rise in California’s projected budget deficit, from $9.2 billion in January, is forcing state officials to propose a new series of midyear cuts in already battered programs.

headline.seo: Huge New Shortfall Predicted in California Budget
headline.main: Shortfall in California’s Budget Swells to $16 Billion
headline.print_headline: New Spending Cuts as California Shortfall Swells by Almost $7 Billion
